TopicTitle: Calculate Center of Thrust for selected engines

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

the title basically says it all: How do I calculate the Center of Thrust for some selected engines? I think I need a position Vector of every enngine, and also another Vector that points in the thrust direction of each engine. Or is there a way to calcualte these with the attachedAngles of the engine?

I am also quite unfamiliar with the Coordinate System of the ship. I looked into a config file of a very simple spacecraft and was confused, because the capsule was not at (0|0|0) coordinates, and engines that i placed on the x,y an z axis didn't show (0|0|x) rotation as I expected. Why are there four rotation axis???

I hope you can help!

regards,

Simon

My first thought would be to simply use the thrust transform. That is where KSP applies the thrust from the engine and so would work for your location I would think. You'd have to grab the thrust magnitude separately but that is just the ModuleEnigine.MaxThrust field.

That would only get you the location and magnitude of the thrust of each individual engine though, I'm not sure how to go about evening things out to find the center of thrust.

On the co-ordinate system, things get fun there. First, the root part of the vessel is the part that is at the 0,0,0 location, but only in Flight. If you are looking in the Editor (.craft file), the part's position is relative to the Editor building itself. Also, the root part does not have to be the capsule, it is usually the first part placed. Second, the reason there are 4 values is that Unity (which KSP runs on) uses Quaternions for its rotation values. Trying to manipulate those directly is pretty much impossible, look at the in-game functions offered to try and match what you are after. Wiki link on quaternions.

Can you describe what you are trying to do? That would give us an opportunity to suggest how to manipulation the quaternions to do what you are after.

D.

Hello, I'm having a similar need as well.

I'm trying to create a VTOL, that's rather large for a space plane, and I need to know where the center of thrust is with my vertical engines, excluding my horizontal engines thrust but including their mass. I try to use parts that approximate their mass and won't contribute to the center of thrust, but it leads to a lot of trial and error. I would just like to not include them in the center of thrust calculation.

The easiest way to do this in the VAB/SPH is to simply tweak the thrust of your horizontal engines down to zero. Make sure you put them back before launching though...

You could also try looking at the code of various mods to work out how they calculate thrust for multiple engines, e.g. MechJeb or any of several VTOL thrust balancing mods...
